posts.content: I logged into ThingSpeak and attempted to clear my channel of some random testing data I had sent to it, using the below link (substituting my actual channel number for xxxxx):https://thingspeak.com/channels/xxxxx/clearbut I just got an error message. This is repeatable.  Has anyone else seen this?We're sorry, but something went wrong.Please send an email to support@thingspeak.com if this problem persists.
posts.author: jbeale

posts.content: Update: I got this to work using a different browser (Chrome instead of Firefox). Might have been a cookie setting or lack thereof (?)

posts.content: Hi,Sometimes our clearing channels process has some problems, but we're working on fixing it.  (It probably wasn't the browser settings.)lee

What protocols are used Thingspeak (aka UDP)? On my computer with Windows10 and Chrome, connected to the same router, the channels open and I can change them.  I think I need to ask your mobile phone operator to unlock something. But what?
posts.author: pilnikov

posts.content: I've been looking for a while how best to log data from a couple of Arduino Mega's which are running my new hydroponics system when I stumbled across this site.Brilliant, it does exactly what I need; from a really simple Arduino API, through to cloud logging, analytics and alerting (via Prowl).I originally experimented with logging to a Google Spreadsheet but there aren't any reliable https libraries for the Arduino plus it's a lot of additional overhead.  I also tried logging to an SD Card (historical data) and created a real-time website on the Arduino to see what's going on (real-time) - it worked to a fashion but having to wonder down the garden to get the SD card in the rain and import the CSV was a pain.What really liked was just how easy this is, just identify a few variables, #include an Ardino library, a couple of coffee's and it was done!Time to hit eBay for a few more LAN shields to IoT my other projects!
posts.author: HydroponicsMAC

posts.content: Glad that you found us. Thanks for the feedback and have fun with your projects!
posts.author: Hans

posts.author: yangtylor

posts.content: Is there any way to delete a range of data from a channel?  For example, I've got 200k records in one channel and I want to remove the first 100k (in a contiguous date range).Assuming there's no direct way of doing this, could I export the data, remove those records, and then import the clean csv back into Thingspeak?  Would there be any adverse affects (maintaining the original timestamp is important) or potential gotchas that I need to be aware of?Thanks,brad
posts.author: AYAduino

posts.content: Second this.Bringing a new sensor on-line and know my earlier data on one field is badly skewed. Would love to be able to easily delete those data points
posts.author: BSB

posts.content: There was trouble some time ago but not so much lately. http://community.thingspeak.com/forum/general/i-can-not-download-my-data/#p1042I would try importing the revised data to a new channel first before I deleted the original channel, that way you can  assure yourself you didn't modify anything you didn't intend to.

posts.content: Hi,We do not delete user data, so it will be available until users delete it by clearing or deleting their channel.  We have data points on our servers going back to 2010.lee
